docs.lead_paragraph: The basis of a possible revolution in treating heart attack patients has been laid by three reports of using stem cells from bone marrow to repair heart tissue in animals. In one of the studies, apparently functional heart tissue was regenerated from the injected cells, the first such success in some two decades of effort. In another, the stem cells morphed into new blood vessels that rescued the heart cells around the damaged area from their usual course of overgrowth and death. In the third, stem cells were used to strengthen pig hearts.
docs.abstract: Three groups of researchers report promising results using stem cells from bone marrow to repair heart tissue in animals; say testing on humans is at least year away; one of studies succeeded in generating apparently functional heart tissue from injected cells, first such success ever; diagram; photo (M)
docs.snippet: The basis of a possible revolution in treating heart attack patients has been laid by three reports of using stem cells from bone marrow to repair heart tissue in animals.     In one of the studies, apparently functional heart tissue was regenerated...

docs.lead_paragraph: An anesthesia drug, Raplon, is being taken off the market because five patients died while receiving it, the Food and Drug Administration announced. Two of the deaths were children, one aged 4 and the other 10. The oldest adult was 49.

headline.main: Anesthesia Drug Is Removed From Market After the Deaths of 5 Patients

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration says Organon pharmaceutical company is voluntarily removing its anesthesia drug Raplon from market because of deaths of five patients (M)
docs.snippet: An anesthesia drug, Raplon, is being taken off the market because five patients died while receiving it, the Food and Drug Administration announced.     Two of the deaths were children, one aged 4 and the other 10. The oldest adult was 49.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than two decades ago, a resilient group of South Bronx residents united to rehabilitate abandoned buildings in their deteriorating neighborhood. Their grass-roots group, which they called Banana Kelly for the curved street where it was born, helped spawn an era of activism in the Bronx and became a much-studied model for neighborhood redevelopment. But in recent years, the Banana Kelly Community Improvement Association has been more a model of disarray; its buildings and finances are poorly maintained, troubling questions have been raised about its oversight and management practices, and several investigations of the organization appear to be under way.

headline.main: A Rebuilder In the Bronx Scales Back

docs.abstract: Rev Louis R Gigante says nonprofit group Southeast Bronx Community Organization is taking over management of 25 occupied apartment buildings from Banana Kelly Community Improvement Assn, a neighborhood redevelopment group; Banana Kelly's buildings and finances are poorly maintained, troubling questions have been raised about its oversight and management practices, and several investigations of organization appear to be under way; Banana Kelly will continue to exist for sole purpose as provider of social services in community (M)
